tool.name: IPA gibbs sampler
tool.command: python3 '${__tool_directory__}/ipapy2_gibbs_sampler.py' --mapped_isotope_patterns '${mapped_isotope_patterns}' --annotations '${annotations}' --integrating_mode '${integrating_mode.integrating_mode}' #if $integrating_mode.integrating_mode == "adducts" --delta_add '${integrating_mode.delta_add}' #elif $integrating_mode.integrating_mode == "biochemical" --Bio '${integrating_mode.Bio}' --delta_bio '${integrating_mode.delta_bio}' #else --delta_add '${integrating_mode.delta_add}' --Bio '${integrating_mode.Bio}' --delta_bio '${integrating_mode.delta_bio}' #end if --gibbs_out "${gibbs_out}" --annotations_out "${annotations_out}" --noits '${noits}' #if $burn is not None --burn '${burn}' #end if #if $all_out is not None --all_out '${all_out}' #end if #if $zs_file is not None --zs_out '${zs_file}' #end if

param.label: Mapped isotope patterns
param.name: mapped_isotope_patterns
param.help: pandas dataframe containing the MS1 data.

param.label: annotations
param.name: annotations
param.help: pandas dataframe containing all the possible annotations for the measured features.

param.label: gibbs sampler iterations
param.name: noits
param.help: number of iterations if the Gibbs sampler to be run.

param.label: ignored iterations
param.name: burn
param.help: number of iterations to be ignored when computing posterior probabilities. If None, is set to 10% of total iterations.

param.label: return each iteration
param.name: all_out
param.help: logical value. If true the list of assignments found in each iteration is returned by the function. Default False.

param.label: previous Gibbs sampler
param.name: zs_file
param.help: list of assignments computed in a previous run of the Gibbs sampler. Optional, default None.

param.label: output Gibbs parameter
param.name: gibbs_out
param.help: list of assignments computed in a previous run of the Gibbs sampler. Optional, default None.

param.name: delta_add
param.label: adducts weight
param.help: parameter used when computing the conditional priors. The parameter must be positive. The smaller the parameter the more weight the adducts connections have on the posterior probabilities. Default 1.

param.name: Bio
param.label: biochemical connections
param.help: dataframe (2 columns), reporting all the possible connections between compounds. It uses the unique ids from the database. It could be the output of Compute_Bio() or Compute_Bio_Parallel().

param.name: delta_bio
param.label: biochemical weight
param.help: parameter used when computing the conditional priors. The parameter must be positive. The smaller the parameter the more weight the biochemical connections have on the posterior probabilities. Default 1.

param.name: delta_add
param.label: adducts weight
param.help: parameter used when computing the conditional priors. The parameter must be positive. The smaller the parameter the more weight the adducts connections have on the posterior probabilities. Default 1.

param.name: Bio
param.label: biochemical connections
param.help: dataframe (2 columns), reporting all the possible connections between compounds. It uses the unique ids from the database. It could be the output of Compute_Bio() or Compute_Bio_Parallel().

param.name: delta_bio
param.label: biochemical weight
param.help: parameter used when computing the conditional priors. The parameter must be positive. The smaller the parameter the more weight the biochemical connections have on the posterior probabilities. Default 1.

has_line.line: id,name,formula,adduct,m/z,charge,RT range,ppm,isotope pattern score,fragmentation pattern score,prior,post,post Gibbs,chi-square pval,peak_id

tool.help: :: Gibbs sampler for the IPA model.
